Standard_Text:

criteria based on personal

and cultural) to evaluate

musical selections.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Apply Criteria to Evaluate Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Explain and support
possible interpretations
of the expressive intent
and meaning of musical
selections, citing as evidence
the treatment of the
elements of music, context
(personal, social, and
cultural), (when applicable)
the setting of the text, and
outside sources.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Interpret Intent and Meaning in Artistic Work

Standard_Text:
Compare passages in
musical selections and

music and context (social,
cultural, or historical) inform

Standard_Text:
Apply criteria to select
music for specified purposes,

characteristics found in

to interest, purpose, and
context (social, cultural, and
historical).
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Perceive and Analyze Artistic Work

Standard_Text: Responding
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Perform with expression
and technical accuracy,
in individual and small
group performances, a
varied repertoire of music
that includes melodies,
improvisations, and chordal
accompaniments in a variety
of patterns, demonstrating
sensitivity to the audience
and an understanding of the
context (social, cultural, or
historical).
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Convey Meaning Through the Presentation of Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Develop and apply criteria
to critique individual and
small group performances
of a varied repertoire of
music that includes melodies,
improvisations, and
chordal accompaniments
in a variety of patterns, and
create rehearsal strategies
to address performance
challenges and refine the
performances.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Develop and Refine Artistic Techniques and Work for Presentation
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Describe in interpretations
the context (social, cultural,
or historical) and expressive
intent in a varied repertoire
of music selected for
performance that includes
melodies, improvisations, and
chordal accompaniments in
a variety of patterns.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Identify and describe
important theoretical and
structural characteristics

cultural, or historical) in a
varied repertoire of music
that includes melodies,
improvisations, and chordal
accompaniments in a variety
of patterns.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Explain the criteria used
when selecting a varied
repertoire of music for
individual or small group
performances that include
melodies, improvisations, and
chordal accompaniments in
a variety of patterns.

Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Performing

Standard_Text:
Perform final versions of

and three-or-more
chord accompaniments

skill in applying principles of
composition/improvisation
and originality in developing
and organizing musical ideas.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Develop and apply criteria
to critique, improve, and
refine drafts of improvisations,
compositions and three or more chord accompaniments
in a variety of patterns.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Refine and Complete Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Select, develop, and use
standard notation and audio/
video recording to document
melodic, rhythmic, and
harmonic ideas for drafts of
improvisations, compositions,
and three-or-more chord
accompaniments in a variety
of patterns.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Organize and Develop Artistic Ideas and Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Generate melodic, rhythmic,
and harmonic ideas for
improvisations, compositions,
and three-or-more chord
accompaniments in a variety
of patterns.

Identify and

connections

Identify and
demonstrate how

experiences, and
ideas relate to
creating, performing,
and responding to
music.

Musicians connect their personal interests, experiences, ideas, and knowledge to creating, performing, and
responding

Standard_Text:
Evaluate musical
works and
performances,
applying
established criteria,
and describe
appropriateness to
the context.

The personal evaluation of musical work(s) and performance(s) is informed by analysis, interpretation, and
established criteria.

Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Demonstrate
and describe
how expressive
qualities (such as
dynamics, tempo,
and timbre) are
used in performers’
personal
interpretations to
reflect creators’
expressive intent.

Standard_Text:
Through their use of elements and structures of music, creators and performers provide clues to their expressive
intent.

Demonstrate and
describe how a
response to music
can be informed by
the structure, the
use of the elements
of music, and
context (such as
personal and social).

Standard_Text:
Response to music is informed by analyzing context (social, cultural, and historical) and how creators and
performers manipulate the elements of music.

Standard_Text:
Demonstrate and
describe how
selected music
connects to and
is influenced by
specific interests,
experiences, or
purposes.

Demonstrate
performance

audience etiquette
appropriate for the
context and venue.

Standard_Text:
Perform music for
a specific purpose
with expression and
technical accuracy
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Musicians judge performance based on criteria that vary across time, place, and cultures. The context and how a
work is presented influence audience response.

Standard_Text:
Rehearse to

identified

Apply teacher-provided and
collaboratively
developed criteria

To express their musical ideas, musicians analyze, evaluate, and refine their performance over time through
openness to new ideas, persistence, and the application of appropriate criteria.

When analyzing

Demonstrate
understanding of
the structure in

Analyzing creators’ context and how they manipulate elements of music provides insight into their intent and
informs performance.

and explain how

Performers’ interest in and knowledge of musical works, understanding of their own technical skill, and the
context for a performance influence the selection of repertoire.

Present the final

connection to
expressive intent.

teacher-provided
and collaboratively

Musicians evaluate and refine their work through openness to new ideas, persistence, and the application of
appropriate criteria.

Use standard
and/or iconic

Generate musical

Practice and

Construct and

Standard_Text: Creating
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Find a relationship
between movement
in a dance from a
culture, society, or
community and the
culture from which
the dance is derived.
Explain what
the movements
communicate about
key aspects of the
culture, society, or
community.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Relate Artistic Ideas and Works with Societal, Cultural, and Historical Context to Deepen Understanding
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Ask and research
a question about
a key aspect of
a dance that
communicates a
perspective about
an issue or event.
Explore the key
aspect through
movement. Share
movements and
describe how the
movements help
to remember
or discover new
qualities in these
key aspects.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Compare the
relationships
expressed in
a dance to
relationships with
others. Explain how
they are the same
or different.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Connecting

Standard_Text:
Select dance
movements
from specific
genres, styles, or
cultures. Identify
characteristic
movements from
these dances and
describe in basic
dance terminology
ways in which they
are similar and
different.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Apply Criteria to Evaluate Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Select specific
context cues from
movement. Explain
how they relate to
the main idea of the
dance using basic
dance terminology
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Demonstrate
and explain how
one dance genre
is similar to and
different from
another, or how one

practice is similar to
and different from
another.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Find a movement
pattern that creates
a movement phrase
in a dance work.

Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Responding
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Explore
production
elements for a
dance performed
for an audience in a
designated specific
performance space.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Identify the
main areas of a
performance space
using production
terminology (e.g.,
stage right, stage
left, center stage,
upstage, and
downstage).

Standard_Text: Convey Meaning Through the Presentation of Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Recall movement
sequences with a
partner or in group
dance activities.
Apply constructive
feedback from
teacher and selfcheck to improve
dance skills.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Adjust body-use
to coordinate with
a partner or other
dancers to safely
change levels,
directions, and
pathway designs.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Replicate body
shapes, movement
characteristics,
and movement
patterns in a dance
sequence with
awareness of body
alignment and core
support.

Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Change
use of energy
and dynamics
by modifying
movements and
applying specific
characteristics to
heighten the effect
of their intent.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Fulfill specified
duration of time
with improvised
locomotor and
nonlocomotor
movements.
Differentiate between
“in time” and “out
of time” to music.
Perform movements
that are the same
or of a different
time orientation to
accompaniment.
Use metric and
kinesthetic phrasing.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Judge spaces as
distance traveled
and use space
three-dimensionally.
Demonstrate
shapes with positive
and negative space.
Perform movement
sequences in and
through space with
intentionality and
focus.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

choices in response

dance study.

document the
differences the
changes made in
the movements.

Develop a
dance phrase that

communicates an
idea or feeling.
Discuss the effect
of the movement
choices.

Identify and
experiment with
choreographic
devices to create
simple movement
patterns and dance
structures.

Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Explore a
given movement
problem. Select
and demonstrate a
solution.

Experiment with
a variety of selfidentified stimuli
(e.g., music/sound,

notation, observed
dance, experiences)
for movement.

and why groups

choices are made

drama/theatre
work, with peers as

and vocal exploration
